artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōhashiya Yashichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 220 [unlisted]; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 286 [unlisted]
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: ink drawing with blue, green, yellow and red; standing man with feet wide apart, holding sword over his head, scowling in anger; man has long black hair and wears greenish-blue blouse with gold dragons, red pants and skirt with wave patterns; rounded dark doorway at left behind figures; flowers, URC; attached to off-white mount sheet
medium: Preparatory drawing for a print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Heroes of the ‘Tales of the Water Margin’ (Gōketsu suikoden 豪傑水滸傳)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Tao Zongwang and Zhang Heng are members of the band of rogue heroes whose adventures form the core of the popular Chinese novel from the 1300s called The Tales of the Water Margin (Shuihuzhuan; Jap.: Suikoden). In the summer of 1868, Yoshitoshi produced an unknown number of designs for a series of portraits of these heroes that Ōhashiya Yashichi then published. These two hand-colored drawings are not among the nine that were printed. The publisher might have stopped further production because sales were underwhelming.
title: Nine-Tailed-Turtle Tao Zongwang
